ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Timepoint/visit label
Notes: e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2; Morning, At Bedtime

ElementDescription: What 12 month period (month and year range) is the participant being asked about on this form?
Enter the year in which the first month (month 1) falls
Enter the year in which the last month of the 12(month 12) falls
Select the 12 months of the given year(s) that you are asking the participant about. Months of first year
Select the 12 months of the given year(s) that you are asking the participant about. Months of second year
Month name & year
Any life events in the specified month since visit?
Life Event 1: Describe
Life Event 1: Impact
Notes: -4=Severe Negative Impact; -3=Marked Negative Impact; -2=Moderate Negative Impact; -1=Mild Negative Impact; 0=No Impact; 1=Mild Positive Impact; 2=Moderate Positive Impact; 3=Marked Positive Impact; 4=Severe Positive Impact

ElementDescription: Life Event 2: Describe
Life Event 2: Impact
Notes: -4=Severe Negative Impact; -3=Marked Negative Impact; -2=Moderate Negative Impact; -1=Mild Negative Impact; 0=No Impact; 1=Mild Positive Impact; 2=Moderate Positive Impact; 3=Marked Positive Impact; 4=Severe Positive Impact

ElementDescription: Life Event 3: Describe
Life Event 3: Impact
Notes: -4=Severe Negative Impact; -3=Marked Negative Impact; -2=Moderate Negative Impact; -1=Mild Negative Impact; 0=No Impact; 1=Mild Positive Impact; 2=Moderate Positive Impact; 3=Marked Positive Impact; 4=Severe Positive Impact

ElementDescription: Life Event 4: Describe
Life Event 4: Impact
Notes: -4=Severe Negative Impact; -3=Marked Negative Impact; -2=Moderate Negative Impact; -1=Mild Negative Impact; 0=No Impact; 1=Mild Positive Impact; 2=Moderate Positive Impact; 3=Marked Positive Impact; 4=Severe Positive Impact

ElementDescription: Life Event 5: Describe
Life Event 5: Impact
Notes: -4=Severe Negative Impact; -3=Marked Negative Impact; -2=Moderate Negative Impact; -1=Mild Negative Impact; 0=No Impact; 1=Mild Positive Impact; 2=Moderate Positive Impact; 3=Marked Positive Impact; 4=Severe Positive Impact

ElementDescription: How was the participant's mood in specified month ? (Describe)
Based on the response, did the participant have any depressive symptoms in the specified month?
Were their depressive symptoms mild, moderate, or severe in the specified month?
Briefly describe ''other'' choice for depression severity in specified month
Based on the response, did the participant have any manic symptoms in the specified month?
Were their manic symptoms mild, moderate, or severe in the specified month?
Briefly describe ''other'' choice for manic severity in specified month
Was the participant hospitalized for psychiatric reasons during the specified month?
Were they hospitalized because of any of the following in the specified month? Depressive symptoms
Were they hospitalized because of any of the following in the specified month? Manic symptoms
Were they hospitalized because of any of the following in the specified month? Other symptoms
Briefly describe other reasons for psychiatric hospitalization in the specified month.
Any other notes about the specified month?
